headline: People with disabilities are two to four times more likely to die in a natural disaster.
Almost a year after the fires, Los Angeles air quality is still toxic to vulnerable communities
dek: Lingering pollutants are still making Los Angeles unsafe for people with respiratory issues, even months later.

headline: Smoke damage and evacuation trauma still linger in Altadena senior apartment complex
dek: How a botched evacuation is still impacting Altadena seniors

headline: FEMA headline
dek: The termination of FEMA programs will impact people with disabilities more severely.

headline: Electric utility unexpectedly terminates contract with disability disaster relief group
dek: Southern California Edison unexpectedly terminated it's contract with the Disability Disaster Access & Resources divison, putting crucial services at risk
